intro: Octoknema winkleri, commonly known as the Winkler's octoknema, is a rare and little-studied plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes many aromatic and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
